data.text: @chrisprener @CDCgov What do you think of that green in the boot heel? Is percent positive considered?

@Unicorn54Girl @chrisprener @CDCgov Got a text from a friend in DC wondering if she should stop wearing masks. 

I said no, and if you're in an enclosed space with other people for hours, wear an N95.

@chrisprener @meganranney Meanwhile the media uses misleading data to provide cover for antimaskers to cosplay 2019, no matter the cost to the vulnerable.

https://t.co/AVmRJCzacK
@chrisprener @CDCgov I honestly don't get it.  Even in the yellow and green areas, there are immunocompromised and kids under 5.  Are we just throwing them to the wolves?
@chrisprener @CDCgov Let's be clear, I don't know who made this but I'm completely on board with it. https://t.co/WeRByXFNqc

@chrisprener @CDCgov As someone in a county w/ <40% 💉x2, I don't see any lessons learned here, no plan tweaked or investment made for next wave/next pandemic. County Commissioner is running "we're proud we did nothing" re-election campaign. Can't wait to spend months in Canada.

@chrisprener @CDCgov I wonder how many people see these new recommendations and actually change their behaviors? We will continue to mask in indoor spaces through the winter, at the very least. But wouldnâ€™t mind a meal in a restaurant again soon 😏
